channel.title: productivity on rmoff's random ramblings
channel.description: Recent content in productivity on rmoff's random ramblings

item.title: Searching Alfred's Clipboard history programatically
item.description: Alfred is one of my favourite productivity apps for the Mac. It’s a file indexer, a clipboard manager, a snippet expander - and that’s just scratching the surface really. I recently got a new machine without it installed and realised just how much I rely on Alfred, particularly its clipboard manager.

item.title: Migrating Alfred Clipboard to New Laptop
item.description: Alfred is one of my favourite productivity tools. One of its best features is the clipboard history, which when I moved laptops and it didn’t transfer I realised quite how much I rely on this functionality in my day-to-day work. Whilst Alfred has the options to syncronise its preferences across machines, it seems that it doesn’t synchronise the clipboard database. To get it to work I did the following:
